content.body: No it's not; you need to write `arr.map(obj::obj.method)`
content.formatted_body: No it's not; you need to write arr.map(obj::obj.method)

content.body: If you've *already* extracted the method into a variable, you can write the simpler way, but that's not the case I usually run into.
content.formatted_body: If you've already extracted the method into a variable, you can write the simpler way, but that's not the case I usually run into.

content.body: oh, right, that only works if `method` is extracted. maybe i was thinking of the original bind operator proposal where it'd be `::obj.method`
content.formatted_body: oh, right, that only works if method is extracted. maybe i was thinking of the original bind operator proposal where it'd be ::obj.method

content.body: Yeah, that's a persistent confusion for me as well. ^_^
(The fact that you have to write `obj::obj.method` for what would, I suspect, be a pretty major use-case is, to me, a pretty bad strike against the current bind-this proposal.)
content.formatted_body: (The fact that you have to write obj::obj.method for what would, I suspect, be a pretty major use-case is, to me, a pretty bad strike against the current bind-this proposal.)

content.body: hm, i'm not sure it would be that major tho
the use cases are mostly about changing the receiver, and `obj.method.bind(obj)` is separate from that
content.formatted_body: the use cases are mostly about changing the receiver, and obj.method.bind(obj) is separate from that

content.body: The stated use-cases are mostly about that, yes, because hard-binding the existing receiver is inconvenient in the current syntax so of course it's not emphasizing that use-case. ^_^

i really don't think it's all that important tho. typically it comes up on a class method, and the class can do `foo = this.foo.bind(this)` as a class field (or a `@bind` decorator) - how often does a consumer of the class need to do that?
content.formatted_body: i really don't think it's all that important tho. typically it comes up on a class method, and the class can do foo = this.foo.bind(this) as a class field (or a @bind decorator) - how often does a consumer of the class need to do that?

content.body: I've wanted to map a method across an array multiple times in my past code. It's no stranger than mapping a free function.
